bin/linkern.c

00001 /**********************************************************doxygen*//** @file
00002  * @brief   Lin-Kernighan TSP heuristic.
00003  *
00004  * Runs the Lin-Kernighan TSP heuristic on the given input file.  This
00005  * is really nothing more than a wrapper to Concorde, and is for testing
00006  * purposes only.  Use Concorde's executable for access to solve options.
00007  *
00008  * @author  John LaRusic
00009  * @ingroup bin
00010  ****************************************************************************/
00011 #include "arrow.h"
00012 #include <getopt.h>
00013 
00014 /**
00015  *  @brief  Prints help/usage message.
00016  */
00017 void 
00018 print_help();
00019 
00020 /**
00021  *  @brief  Prints version message.
00022  */
00023 void 
00024 print_version();
00025 
00026 /**
00027  *  @brief  Prints usage message.
00028  */
00029 void 
00030 print_usage();
00031 
00032 /**
00033  *  @brief  Reads program arguments.
00034  */
00035 void 
00036 read_args(int argc, char *argv[]);
00037 
00038 /* Program options */
00039 char *program_name;             /**< Program name */
00040 char *input_file;               /**< Given input TSPLIB file */
00041 int random_restarts = -1;
00042 int stall_count = -1;
00043 int kicks = -1;
00044 
00045 /****************************************************************************
00046  * Function implemenations
00047  ****************************************************************************/
00048 int 
00049 main(int argc, char *argv[])
00050 {   
00051     /* Read program arguments */
00052     program_name = argv[0];
00053     read_args(argc, argv);
00054         
00055     /* Try and read the problem file and its info */
00056     arrow_problem problem;
00057     if(!arrow_problem_read(input_file, &problem))
00058     {
00059         arrow_print_error("Could not read input file.\n");
00060     }
00061     
00062     /* Setup Lk parameters structure */
00063     arrow_tsp_lk_params params;
00064     arrow_tsp_lk_params_init(&problem, &params);
00065     if(random_restarts >= 0)    params.random_restarts  = random_restarts;
00066     if(stall_count >= 0)        params.stall_count      = stall_count;
00067     if(kicks >= 0)              params.kicks            = kicks;
00068     
00069     /* Solve TSP */
00070     arrow_tsp_result result;
00071     if(!arrow_tsp_result_init(&problem, &result))
00072         arrow_print_error("Could not initialize result structure.\n");
00073     
00074     if(!arrow_tsp_lk_solve(&problem, &params, &result))
00075         arrow_print_error("Could not solve LK on file.\n");
00076     
00077     printf("\nFound Tour: %d\n", result.found_tour);
00078     printf("Tour length: %5.0f\n", result.obj_value);
00079     printf("Total Time: %5.2f\n", result.total_time);
00080     
00081     /* Free up the structures */
00082     arrow_tsp_lk_params_destruct(&params);
00083     arrow_tsp_result_destruct(&result);
00084     arrow_problem_destruct(&problem);
00085     
00086     return EXIT_SUCCESS;
00087 }
00088 
00089 void 
00090 print_help()
00091 {
00092     print_usage(program_name);
00093     printf("\n");
00094     printf("Runs the bottleneck biconnected spanning subgraph problem on\n");
00095     printf("the given TSPLIB file.\n");
00096     printf("\n");
00097     printf("Options:\n");
00098     printf("  -h, --help                print this help, then exit\n");
00099     printf("  -V, --version             print version number, then exit\n");
00100     printf("\n");
00101     printf("Report bugs to <johnlr@gmail.com>.\n");
00102 }
00103 
00104 void 
00105 print_version()
00106 {
00107     printf("%s (Arrow TSP) 1.0\n", program_name);
00108     printf("(c) Copyright 2006-2008\n");
00109     printf("    John LaRusic, Eric Aubanel, and Abraham Punnen.\n");
00110     printf("\n");
00111     printf("This is free software.  You may redistribute copies of it\n");
00112     printf("under the terms of the GNU General Public License \n");
00113     printf("    <http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl.html>.\n");
00114     printf("There is NO WARRANTY, to the extent permitted by law.\n");
00115     printf("\n");
00116     printf("Written by John LaRusic.\n");
00117 }
00118 
00119 void 
00120 print_usage()
00121 {
00122     printf("Usage: %s [options] tsplib_file\n", program_name);
00123 }
00124 
00125 void 
00126 read_args(int argc, char *argv[])
00127 {
00128     int opt_idx;
00129     char opt;
00130     char *short_options = "hVr:s:k:";
00131     struct option long_options[] =
00132     {
00133         {"help", no_argument, 0, 'h'},
00134         {"version", no_argument, 0, 'V'},
00135         {"restarts", required_argument, 0, 'r'},
00136         {"stalls", required_argument, 0, 's'},
00137         {"kicks", required_argument, 0, 'k'}
00138     };
00139 
00140     while(1)
00141     {
00142         opt = getopt_long(argc, argv, short_options, long_options, &opt_idx);
00143         if(opt == -1) break;
00144         
00145         switch (opt)
00146         {
00147             case 'h':
00148                 print_help(argv[0]);
00149                 exit(EXIT_SUCCESS);
00150                 break;
00151             case 'V':
00152                 print_version(argv[0]);
00153                 exit(EXIT_SUCCESS);
00154                 break;
00155             case 'r':
00156                 random_restarts = atoi(optarg);
00157                 break;
00158             case 's':
00159                 stall_count = atoi(optarg);
00160                 break;
00161             case 'k':
00162                 kicks = atoi(optarg);
00163                 break;
00164             default:
00165                 printf("Option: %c\n", opt);
00166                 print_usage(argv[0]);
00167                 exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00168         }
00169     }
00170     
00171     /* Read the file name to process */
00172     if(optind == argc)
00173     {
00174         arrow_print_error("No problem files specified.\n");
00175         print_usage(argv[0]);
00176         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00177     }
00178     else if(optind < argc - 1)
00179     {
00180         arrow_print_error("Multiple input files specified.\n");
00181         print_usage(argv[0]);
00182         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00183     }
00184     input_file = argv[optind];    
00185 }
